content: Ahimsa and ahinsa are alternative spellings of the same word. Ahimsa is a Sanskrit word that means "non-violence" or "non-injury." It is a key principle in Hinduism, Jainism, and Buddhism, and is often considered the highest virtue in these traditions. The practice of ahimsa involves avoiding harm to all living beings and promoting peace, compassion, and kindness in thought, word, and deed.
